intro: Nihon krameri, commonly known as Japanese krameri, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its flowers bloom in the summer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Nihon krameri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
